result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
3:33 PM Gerraud Abdul Bruns appeared in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DE does not qualify for PD - PFAC. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of No possession of firearms and AS, no objection. Court so orders. Waive time limits. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:40 pm.
Status conference scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
